The book can be pre-ordered through @CambridgeUP now and will be published in May.

The book introduces the main fissures and fault-lines in the fields of #modernslavery and #humantrafficking, their intersections with labor migration, and histories of slavery. We hope it will be of interest to academics, but also and especially to students and the public.

In it, historians social scientists, modern slavery champions skeptics, debate big questions like: Do anti-slavery efforts crowd out support for migrant / labor rights? Do they mask naturalise racial / gender inequality? Are uses of history accurate and appropriate?
